intro: Lettsomia maymyo, commonly known as the Maymyo bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, often with a contrasting purple or violet throat. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Lettsomia maymyo thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a suitable addition to rock gardens or woodland borders.
